title: Mount Rio Branco
text: Mount Rio Branco () is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a>, 975 m, standing 2.5 nautical miles (4.6 km) east of <a href="Cape%20Perez">Cape Perez</a> on the west coast of <a href="Graham%20Land">Graham Land</a>. Discovered by the <a href="French%20Antarctic%20Expedition">French Antarctic Expedition</a>, 1908–10, and named by Charcot for <a href="Baron%20Rio%20Branco">Baron Rio Branco</a>, at that time Minister of <a href="Foreign%20Affairs">Foreign Affairs</a> of Brazil.
